feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the formula configured in the leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll settings daily wage calculator takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists between leave policy and payroll modules for daily wage formula configuration

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: Pro-Rated Amount Decimal Precision Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculation (System: AED 231,821, Manual: AED 252,485). Detailed calculation breakdown revealed system uses specific service duration and daily wage formula with tiered rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex service duration splitting and tiered daily rate application
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparency in gratuity calculation logic that might confuse administrators

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Day
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not transparently handle February 29th in leap years, causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation (912 vs 913 days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not clearly defined or consistently applied.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration and gratuity calculations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses specific methodologies for calculating service duration, including leap year adjustments and day count segmentation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic is intricate and not transparently communicated, potentially leading to misunderstandings about calculation methodology.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Days Worked Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (623 days vs expected 622 days). Daily wage calculation uses a fixed 30-day divisor, which differs from client's preferred method of (Basic × 12 / 365).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation shows minor discrepancy in total days
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential inaccuracy in days worked calculation and inflexible daily wage computation method

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. Users may misunderstand how daily wage is divided (31 vs 30 days) and challenge the resulting prorated salary amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Monthly Leave Salary Accrual Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary based on monthly working days count, which can cause unexpected differences in leave salary accrual reports.
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Independent daily wage configurations prevent consistent salary calculation across leave and proration scenarios
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across different payroll scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. Proration works correctly for past departure dates but not for future dates.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in daily wage calculator's ability to handle dynamic proration scenarios with varying departure and processing dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between the Time Off and Payroll modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts due to a timing mismatch in working days calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holiday configurations change after leave request creation.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days and salary deduction calculations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses non-standard 30.42 day divisor, potentially causing deduction amounts to exceed expected monthly salary
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction - showing 31 days instead of 29 days, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions. The global configuration takes precedence over policy-level settings, calculating deductions using a system-wide daily rate instead of policy-defined methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not reflect the leave occurrence month's rate
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Rigid salary calculation that does not flexibly adapt to individual employee attendance

limitations.title: Payroll Configuration Overrides Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration supersedes leave policy formula for unpaid leave deductions
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify the daily wage calculation in leave policy when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency for Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in gratuity calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Consistent Decimal Undercalculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amounts are consistently calculated with a slight decimal reduction, affecting all employees' End of Service calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in employee final settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at month-end under monthly accrual policy, preventing mid-month leave balance inclusion in EOS calculations
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include partial month's leave balance

limitations.title: Ambiguous Service Days Counting Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling.
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
limitations.limitation_statement: Calculation of gratuity for service periods above 5 years involves nuanced day counting, including special handling for incomplete years and leap year adjustments.
limitations.impact: Potential misunderstandings between system and manual calculations due to complex prorating methodology

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation follows a fixed policy setting that cannot be easily overridden, potentially causing discrepancies between user expectations and system calculations.

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Depends on Working Days
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment daily wage is calculated based on working days, which can vary month to month (e.g., 20 working days in February)
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will not be consistent across months due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use independently configured daily wage formulas, which cannot automatically align without manual intervention
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies and manual configuration required to match client expectations

limitations.title: Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration calculates based on days marked as working in the employee's assigned work week, which may include all 7 days
limitations.impact: Proration may differ from traditional calendar day calculations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Limited Proration Logic for Future Departure Dates
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works accurately when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave management and payroll deduction systems do not have a reliable mechanism for reconciling changes to leave transactions
limitations.impact: Users cannot reliably modify or delete leave requests without risking duplicate or persistent payroll deductions

limitations.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not automatically send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation.
limitations.impact: Prevents accurate retroactive recalculation of salary deductions when public holiday configurations change

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on actual calendar days in the month, with specific handling for months with varying days (e.g., February in leap years)
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deductions by using the precise number of calendar days

limitations.title: System-Wide Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary deductions that do not reflect specific organizational leave policies

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically adjust salary based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks dynamic salary calculation capabilities
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime, tracked separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Greyed out formula in leave policy indicates override by payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll daily wage calculator is configured to take precedence for unpaid leave calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings to understand actual calculation method

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in gratuity calculation between system and MOHRE reference
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System incorrectly calculates service period by using 365 days for leap year instead of 366 days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust calculation to account for 366 days in 2024

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Pro-rated amounts show consistently lower values by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Development team has been escalated and the issue was reportedly resolved. Users should verify calculations after the fix.

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance not automatically included for mid-month departure
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy restricts leave day earning until month-end
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust EOS balance in system or switch to conditional daily accrual policy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Differences in gratuity calculation between manual and system methods
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses specific methodology for counting days in partial years, including leap year adjustments (using 366 as divisor when applicable)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculation by breaking down service period into segments: first 5 years at 21 days per year, subsequent years at 30 days per year, with pro-rata calculation for incomplete years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and calculated leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined daily rate configuration in leave policy, not user's manual calculation method
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand the system's calculation logic before challenging the computed amount

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected variations in leave salary accrual calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, which recalculates daily rate based on monthly working days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Consider using 'custom days' setting for leave encashments to maintain consistent daily wage calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatched salary calculations between expected and system-generated amounts
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or use consistent divisor across calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's work week setup to confirm if all 7 days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed instead of prorated amount for future departure dates

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary based on days worked until departure date

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or persistent payroll deductions after modifying leave transactions

Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and gratuity amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Pro-Rated Amount Decimal Precision Error
claims_to_validate.statement: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
claims_to_validate.statement: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculation (System: AED 231,821, Manual: AED 252,485). Detailed calculation breakdown revealed system uses specific service duration and daily wage formula with tiered rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years).

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Day
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not transparently handle February 29th in leap years, causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation (912 vs 913 days).

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses specific methodologies for calculating service duration, including leap year adjustments and day count segmentation.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Days Worked Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (623 days vs expected 622 days). Daily wage calculation uses a fixed 30-day divisor, which differs from client's preferred method of (Basic × 12 / 365).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. Users may misunderstand how daily wage is divided (31 vs 30 days) and challenge the resulting prorated salary amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Salary Accrual Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, causing calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. Proration works correctly for past departure dates but not for future dates.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between the Time Off and Payroll modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts due to a timing mismatch in working days calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction - showing 31 days instead of 29 days, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions. The global configuration takes precedence over policy-level settings, calculating deductions using a system-wide daily rate instead of policy-defined methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Configuration Overrides Leave Policy
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration supersedes leave policy formula for unpaid leave deductions

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Dependency for Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in gratuity calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Consistent Decimal Undercalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amounts are consistently calculated with a slight decimal reduction, affecting all employees' End of Service calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are only accrued at month-end under monthly accrual policy, preventing mid-month leave balance inclusion in EOS calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Service Days Counting Rules
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling.

claims_to_validate.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
claims_to_validate.statement: Calculation of gratuity for service periods above 5 years involves nuanced day counting, including special handling for incomplete years and leap year adjustments.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation follows a fixed policy setting that cannot be easily overridden, potentially causing discrepancies between user expectations and system calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Depends on Working Days
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment daily wage is calculated based on working days, which can vary month to month (e.g., 20 working days in February)

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary and salary proration use independently configured daily wage formulas, which cannot automatically align without manual intervention

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration calculates based on days marked as working in the employee's assigned work week, which may include all 7 days

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Proration Logic for Future Departure Dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave management and payroll deduction systems do not have a reliable mechanism for reconciling changes to leave transactions

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module does not automatically send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
